meanings.definition: Amebocytes: Cells in the body of invertebrates that move by means of pseudopodia and play a role in immune responses.
meanings.sent1: The amebocytes in the invertebrate's body help fight off infections.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how amebocytes move to understand immune responses better.
meanings.sent3: The amebocytes had a party to celebrate defeating the harmful invaders.
meanings.sent4: The amebocytes acted like tiny warriors, defending the body from harm.
meanings.sent5: Watching the amebocytes in action was like witnessing a microscopic battle.

meanings.definition: Amebocytes: Cells found in the blood of certain invertebrates that are involved in clotting and wound healing.
meanings.sent1: When a wound occurs, amebocytes rush to the site to help stop bleeding.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how amebocytes work together to form clots.
meanings.sent3: The amebocytes threw a clotting party in the bloodstream.
meanings.sent4: Amebocytes are like tiny repairmen fixing leaks in the body's vessels.
meanings.sent5: The image of amebocytes coming together to heal wounds stayed in her mind.
